page.title: 14BIRDS FOUND ON RHUM.
page.content: On{Rhum}there are very many species of birds.{Shearwaters}breed in burrows mostly on{Hallival}which is one of the main mountains of{Rhum. Shags}are scattered around the coast and breed there. There are few cliff_nesting birds such as{Guillemots, Razorbills} and{Kittiwakes}as there are few suitable cliffs. There are colonies of the larger gulls on one or two low headlands and stacks. There are a few eiderducks in the bay. There are some 100{Puffins}on low cliffs. Up to 4 pairs of{Golden Eagles}breed and 3 or 4 pairs of{Greylag Geese}began breeding in 1983 near the gull colonies. Apart from the{Shearwaters} the most important species on Rhum are the{Sea Eagles.}Young{Sea Eagles}have been released over the last ten years and there are hopes of some breeding successfully very soon.
